adverb.description: In a way that produces powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind.
examples: Margaret remembers vividly the day she received the grim news
Twain vividly portrays the brutality of slavery
I am vividly aware of the need for good journalism

adverb.description: In an intensely deep or bright manner.
examples: flowers of different hues shining vividly in the bright sunshine
